abstract: Dylann S Roof, charged in June 2015 shooting deaths of black parishioners during racially motivated attack on Charleston, SC, church, asks Judge Richard M Gergel to temporarily return his defense team for guilt phase of federal death penalty trial; Roof was granted permission to act as his own attorney and plans to represent himself at sentencing phase.

keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: In a written request, Mr. Roof, accused of killing nine blacks in a South Carolina church, asked to represent himself again in the sentencing phase.
snippet: In a written request, Mr. Roof, accused of killing nine blacks in a South Carolina church, asked to represent himself again in the sentencing phase....

headline.main: Dylann Roof Wants His Lawyers Back to Begin Trial
headline.print_headline: Defendant in Killings in Charleston Asks for Lawyers Back
